availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Finis E. Winders (Todd Co., farmer, corporal 1st Ky Light Artillery)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Winders and Jerusha Winders. Resident in Todd County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Todd County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as private and corporal from September 10, 1863, to July 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 277A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 675.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 510.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0148.
